objenome.solver.evolve.mutate

Class PointMutation

  • java.lang.Object
    • objenome.solver.evolve.AbstractOrganismOperator
      • objenome.solver.evolve.mutate.PointMutation
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Listener<ConfigEvent>, GPContainer.GPContainerAware, OrganismOperator

    public class PointMutation
extends AbstractOrganismOperator
implements Listener<ConfigEvent>
    A mutation operator for STGPIndividuals that replaces nodes at random throughout a program tree. Each node in the program tree is replaced according to a set point probability. When a node is selected to be replaced, a node of the same arity and data-type requirements is randomly chosen to replace it. Multiple nodes may be mutated in the same program tree.

    See the #setup() method documentation for a list of configuration parameters used to control this operator.

    Since:
    2.0
    See Also:
    SubtreeMutation

        public PointMutation(boolean autoConfig)

        Parameters:
        autoConfig - whether this operator should automatically update its configuration settings from the config

    • Method Detail

      • setConfig

        public void setConfig(GPContainer config)
        Sets up this operator with the appropriate configuration settings. This method is called whenever a ConfigEvent occurs for a change in any of the following configuration parameters:
        • RandomSequence.RANDOM_SEQUENCE
        • TypedOrganism.SYNTAX
        • POINT_PROBABILITY (defaults to 0.01).
        • PROBABILITY
        Specified by:
        setConfig in interface GPContainer.GPContainerAware
        Overrides:

      • onEvent

        public void onEvent(ConfigEvent event)

        Specified by:
        onEvent in interface Listener<ConfigEvent>
        Parameters:
        event - the fired event object.

      • perform

        public TypedOrganism[] perform(OperatorEvent.EndOperator event,
                               Organism... parents)
        Performs point mutation on the given individual. Each node in the program tree is considered for mutation and is selected with probability set by the point probability. Once selected, a new node of the same arity and data-type requirements is randomly chosen and replaces the node at that mutation point. The mutation continues until all nodes in the tree have been considered.
        Overrides:
        perform in class AbstractOrganismOperator
        Parameters:
        parents - an array of just one individual to undergo subtree mutation. It must be an instance of STGPIndividual.
        event - the end event object to be fired after this operator is performed.
        Returns:
        an array containing one STGPIndividual that was the result of mutating the parent individual
        See Also:
        AbstractOrganismOperator.getEndEvent(Organism...)

      • getEndEvent

        protected PointMutation.EndEvent getEndEvent(Organism... parents)
        Returns a PointMutationEndEvent with the operator and parents set

        Returns:

      • validReplacements

        protected java.util.List<Node> validReplacements(Node n)
        Lists the nodes in the syntax that are valid replacements for the given node n. A node is a valid replacement if it has the same arity and a compatible data-type if given the children of n.
        Parameters:
        n - the node to be replaced
        Returns:
        a list of the nodes that are valid replacements for n

        public int inputSize()
        Returns the number of individuals expected by the operator.

      • setRandomSequence

        public void setRandomSequence(RandomSequence random)
        Sets the random number sequence to use. If automatic configuration is enabled then any value set here will be overwritten by the RandomSequence.RANDOM_SEQUENCE configuration setting on the next config event.
        Parameters:
        random - the random number generator to set

      • getSyntax

        public Node[] getSyntax()
        Returns the array of nodes in the available syntax. Replacement nodes are selected from the nodes in this array.
        Returns:
        an array of the nodes in the syntax

      • setSyntax

        public void setSyntax(Node[] syntax)
        Sets the array of nodes to generate replacement subtrees from. If automatic configuration is enabled then any value set here will be overwritten by the TypedOrganism.SYNTAX configuration setting on the next config event.
        Parameters:
        syntax - an array of nodes to generate new program trees from

        Parameters:
